Name: Central Hungary
Description: Central Hungary is the heart of the country, with the capital Budapest being the cultural, political, and economic center of Hungary.

Name: Western Transdanubia
Description: This region lies on the western side of Hungary, known for its historical towns, natural reserves, and proximity to Austria and Slovakia.

Name: Pannonian Plain
Description: The Southern Great Plain region is known for its vast flatlands, agricultural production, and cultural landmarks.

Name: Northern Hungary
Description: Northern Hungary is famous for its mountainous landscapes, including the Bükk and Mátra mountains, and historical cities such as Eger.

Name: Northern Great Plain
Description: This region is located to the northeast of Hungary, known for its agricultural activities and large rural areas.

Name: Southern Transdanubia
Description: This region in southern Hungary is known for its natural beauty, including the Lake Balaton area and its thermal baths.
